i1.blurb: Fiora challenges nearby enemy Champions to dodge her. She calls out a direction from which she will try to strike. If she can complete her own challenge, she receives a small bonus and calls out a new direction.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Fiora''' identifies the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} of nearby enemy [[champion]]s, marked as an arc around themselves. {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} take {{fd|0.5}} seconds to identify and linger for 15 seconds. After a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} is triggered or times out, '''Fiora''' identifies a new one on her target.

[[Basic attack]]s and damaging [[Champion ability|abilities]] against a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} trigger it to deal {{as|{{fd|2.5}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|4.5}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}} {{tip|true damage|{{as|'''bonus''' true damage}}}}, {{tip|heal}} '''Fiora''' for {{sti|health|{{pp|40 to 115|color=health}}}} and grant her {{pp|type=[[File:Grand Challenge.png|20px|link=]] Grand Challenge's Rank|key=%|4|showtype=true|20 to 50|0 to 3|displayformula=20%+(10%*Grand Challenge's Rank)|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
i1.name: Duelist's Dance
notes: * A {{as|Vital's|buzzword}} direction remains locked at all times regardless of the enemy's position.
** Even if the enemy turns or faces in a different direction the {{as|Vital|buzzword}} will not rotate.
* If '''Fiora''' is on or excessively close to her target she cannot hit {{as|Vitals|buzzword}}.
* {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} can be hit by {{ai|Lunge|Fiora}} and by {{ai|Riposte|Fiora}}.
* {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} damage does not apply {{sti|life steal}}, however {{iis|Hextech Gunblade}} omnivamp passive is applied.

q1.blurb: Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs a nearby enemy, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit effects.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' {{tip|dashes}} a short distance in the target direction then stabs a nearby enemy if one is present. Stabbing an enemy reduces ''Lunge's'' {{sti|cooldown}} by 60%.
The stab deals {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} and applies [[on-hit effect]]s.
q1.name: Lunge
notes: * The stab prioritizes in order of:
** Enemy champion affected by {{ai|Grand Challenge|Fiora}}.
** {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} facing '''Fiora'''.
** Champions who would die to the strike.
** The nearest champion.
** Enemies that would die to the strike.
** The closest enemy.
* ''Lunge'' can target stealthed units and those hidden in the fog of war.
* The [[dash]] '''can''' pass through walls.
* ''Lunge's'' damage will be mitigated if {{ai|Counter Strike|Jax|dodged}}, {{ai|Aegis Protection|Pantheon|blocked}} or if ''Fiora'' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}.
* Cannot be cancelled by {{tip|stasis}} or {{tip|airborne|displacement}} effects.
* Will land (priority order unchanged) even if ''Fiora'' dies.
* Will be disabled if ''Fiora'' is {{tip|ground|grounded}}.
* ''Lunge''s dash speed is affected by movement speed.

w1.blurb: Fiora parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, then stabs in a direction. This stab slows the first enemy champion hit, or stuns them if Fiora blocked an immobilizing effect with this ability.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' poises to strike in the target direction, becoming {{tip|invulnerability|invulnerable}} to non-[[turret]] damage as well as gaining {{tip|crowd control}} and [[debuff]] immunity for the next {{fd|0.75}} seconds. '''Fiora''' is immobile while poised.
After the duration, '''Fiora''' stabs her sword forward, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to enemies in a line.

The first enemy champion struck is also {{tip|slow|slowed}} and {{tip|cripple|crippled}} by 50% for 2 seconds. If '''Fiora''' parries at least one immobilizing effect, ''Riposte'' {{tip|stun|stuns}} the target for the same duration instead.
w1.name: Riposte
notes: * While the in-game tooltip mentions "parrying", and many players refer to the effect as a parry, the functionality of the ability is identical to invulnerability. It will even prevent the damage being dealt by applied damage over times that were already active.
* [[Crowd control]] effects from epic [[monster]]s will be blocked and still count toward the {{tip|stun}} effect against champions.
* [[Debuff]] immunity includes [[summoner spells]], such as {{si|Exhaust}}, as well as damage over times and other effects.
* The following count as immobilizing effects:
** {{tip|Airborne}}
** {{tip|Charm}}
** {{tip|Entangle}}
** {{tip|Flee}}
** {{tip|Root}}
** {{tip|Stasis}}
** {{tip|Stun}}
** {{tip|Suppression}}
** {{tip|Suspension}}
** {{tip|Taunt}}

e1.blurb: Fiora has increased attack speed for the next two attacks. The first attack slows the target, and the second attack will critically strike.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora's''' next two basic attacks within {{tt|4 seconds|Estimated}} gain {{sti|range|25 '''bonus''' range}} and {{sti|{{as|50% '''bonus''' attack speed}}}}.

The first basic attack can never {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}}, but {{tip|slow|slows}} its target by 30% for 1 second, while the second basic attack is guaranteed to {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}} for {{as|100% {{critical damage|100}} AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, reduced by an additive amount.
e1.name: Bladework
notes: * {{ai|Lunge|Fiora}} cannot apply ''Bladework's'' first attack's slow.
* ''Bladework'' will go on cooldown after either its buff wears off or both basic attacks are consumed.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will block only a single hit.

r1.blurb: Fiora reveals all four Vitals on an enemy champion and gains movement speed while near them. If Fiora hits all 4 Vitals or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed over the next few seconds.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' challenges the target enemy champion for 8 seconds, highlighting their four {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} and creates an area around them. While in effect, {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} does not identify new {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} on '''Fiora's''' target.
While near the target, '''Fiora''' gains {{ais|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}.

If she triggers at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}} before her target [[death|dies]], or triggers all four, she creates a {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} that {{tip|heals}} all allied champions within it for {{pp|4|changedisplay=true|type=Vitals hit|2 to 5|color=buzzword}} seconds.
leveling: {{st|Heal Per Second|{{ap|80 to 140}} {{as|(+ 60% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Maximum Heal|{{ap|80*5 to 140*5}} {{as|(+ 300% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
r1.name: Grand Challenge
notes: * Just like with {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} it takes ''Grand Challenge'' {{fd|0.5}} seconds to identify all four {{as|Vitals|buzzword}}.

** If the target dies before all {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} are identified or '''Fiora''' didn't hit at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}}, the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|Victory Zone}} will not trigger and the cooldown of the ability/mana spent are not refunded.
* The damage of this ability scales with {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}}.

* Even if '''Fiora''' dies, the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} will trigger so long as she hit at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}} and they die before the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} wear off.

** When triggering the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} the target is considered dead even if they are being revived (for example: {{ii|Guardian Angel}}, {{ai|Chronoshift|Zilean}}, {{ai|World Ender|Aatrox}}).
* Ally units in {{tip|stasis}} will not be {{tip|heal|healed}} by the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|Victory Zone}}.
** The {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|Victory Zone}} can {{tip|heal}} the summoned {{ui|Rift Herald}}.
